transcripts.text: The flag's in my eyes.  So today's Thursday.
You're going to be staying out here for two days waiting for the president.
Yes.  Can you tell me why you're so excited?

Because he's a Christian and he cares about America and he's trying to make America great and he's doing a good job.  If it hadn't been for the coronavirus, the economy would have skyrocketed a lot more than what it has already.
So you're feeling good about him for the next four years.  How has his performance been so far?

You've been happy?  I give him 90% or 95%.  I mean, sometimes he tweets things that I wished he wouldn't say.  But other than that, he's awesome.  He prays, he reads the Bible, he listens to God.  And he's helping everybody, not just the whites.  He's helping every color.  He doesn't care.  He's not prejudiced.  So I love that.  So this is my second Trump rally and the first one.  we went to Dallas and so I had to drive all the way down there and now I'm only an hour away.  So finally he came to my home here in Tulsa and so we're just so excited to be able to support our president.  Yeah, we got to get first in line, so we're going to be on the floor.  We're going to be close.  We're going to be crying, so excited.  It's going to be the best experience ever.  We're super excited.  And how are you?  You're prepared to spend two days out here?  Oh, yeah, for sure.  We have a shift going on with other people.  We have a hotel room.  We have water, food, everything we need.  We are prepared.  How are you prepared to stay out here?
You're going to be out here for two days straight to see him.

Yeah, I got here yesterday.  Well, I have smoked brisket.  I have plenty of canned stuff, like spam and canned chicken breast and things like that, crackers and cookies, and yeah, I'm ready to go.  So right here, we have some smoked brisket.
Nice.
Yeah, and we hope to have a grill here later, so I have some other meat to grill, and then...
Well, this is somewhat of a necessity.
Of course.
And then a steak right here for later.  All right.
So you're setting up like a whole camp.

You're really going to be cooking.  Oh, yeah.  Ready for it.  And over here, my tent, because of the wind, you see his tent sideways.  I mean, we can't do anything with this stuff out here.  It ripped my tent apart.  So this is what I have.  So here's a little bag of goodies.  bag of goodies here.  so when camping in the city you can't really start a fire to cook.  so I brought things like pork and beans spam and chicken breast in a can.  that's how it goes down.  probably.
most importantly I see you've got plenty of water.
yes plenty of water because that's my dog flex over there.  he's a service animal.
Okay, how many do you want?  Go Trump!  2020.  Go Trump!  Four more years, come on everybody.
Four more years, come on everybody.
Four more years, come on everybody.
Four more years.  There will never be another.  USA Freedom won't come back if we give it away.
It's time to vote, it's time to pray.  Let's join as one, let me hear you say Go Trump!
2020, go Trump!
2020, go Trump!
2020, go Trump!
Keep America great.
Keep America great.
Thank you.

We're supporting Trump, who I believe supports America, the American economy, the religion, freedom of religion, you know, the freedom to dissent we have in America.  A lot of countries have no freedom to dissent.  You dissent, you're dead.  That's your freedom, mostly.
What was your inspiration for the song?

You know what?  We love Trump.  We love America.  We're patriotic.  We're young.  We're 28 and 26.  We can vote, and we do vote, and we want people to know that this is an amazing country.  People try to say it's not great.  People literally say, what's so great about America?  They say, I hate America.  They step on the American flag.  People are saying people are so disrespectful to authority, their parents, their government, our God, you know, and... The police.  Police.  People are so disrespectful in our culture, and the thing is, the Bible says... First, honor your father and mother.  If you can learn to honor your father and mother, whether they're perfect or not, you can learn to honor your teachers.  You can learn to honor your government.  You have to honor authority, and all of us have to learn that more.  I had a boyfriend that told me, you don't honor authority more.  Enough.  And it was true.  You know, I didn't have as much honor as I needed.  And I've decided, you know what, I'm going to pray for authority.  I'm going to stand for people.  If I don't like something, I'm going to go to God about it, and God's going to change it.  You know, I prayed someone out, a sketchy person out of an apartment next to me.  And they were, like, watching us every night.  Like, they're staying in our cars, scared.  And I said, Lord, I pray them out.  They moved within two weeks.  So if you want things done, go to God and pray and watch things change.  Exactly right.  So that's how you change the world.  Pray.  Vote.  Speak.  Fair enough.  Thank you.  I appreciate it.
Thank you.
I'd love for you to just talk about, you're out here early for, two days early for the Trump rally here and you are dressed up as...
Dressed up as the wall.  That's correct.  Yeah.
So tell me about your apparent passion for Mr.

Trump.  Well, what I actually, most people don't know this, but I didn't even vote for Trump in 2016.  I was not even a registered voter.  And what turned me around is how he started keeping his promises once he was in office.  When he got rid of the Trans-Pacific Partnership, took us out of the Paris Climate Accord, that's when I really started paying attention.  And, you know, I was stunned by the amount of things he did that he promised to do.  And that's really what made me become a Trump supporter.
And so what ignited your passion?  that you want to be out here two days early and sort of how are you preparing to be out here in the hot sun for two days?

The first rally I went to, I only got there four hours early.  All right.  So I didn't really get great, great seats.  And I did learn, though, you get there about midnight the night before, you're going to get some chance at the front row.  So I did that.  And then as I discovered from going to rallies and getting there a little bit earlier and earlier, I found out that the experience before the rally, not the same as being in the rally, it's much different, but it's just as enjoyable on a certain level.  And so I come to the rally early, not so much because I want to get a great seat inside or a great place to stand, but really because I enjoy talking to people about conservative politics in an area in which I know it's going to be supported.  And it's not so much me, because I'm pretty forward about my politics, but there are a lot of people who are just like me who did not support Trump in 2016 and now do, and I like hearing their stories about what it was that made them come around.  What sorts of interesting things have you already said out here this time?  Well, there's a lot of international media here.  This is not just a normal, this is not a normal rally.  I mean, face it, we've had a layoff for a while.  There's a lot of themes that are going to be difficult to tackle.  There's going to be COVID, there's police reform, the economy, and It's really, you know, getting back into the normal for campaign season.  And because of that, there's a lot of, it's not just the normal local networks that are feeding their footage upwards.  You know, big networks are here, international media is here, and it's a much more intense degree of coverage.
And so it's important for you to sort of be a part of supporting him?  Like, is the experience for you or is the experience to sort of help him in that way?

Well, I think it's more for me.  I really enjoy this.  And, you know, there aren't – I had the opportunity to come.  I had the vacation time.  I was able to get off work.  I flew out here from San Diego.  And, you know, I enjoy this, but I also do enjoy supporting the cause.  So maybe it's a little of both.

Oh, I just wanted to come up here.  I've been wanting to come to the rally for a very long time.  The president works real hard for us.  I support his agenda, the plan for America.  So I wanted to come and cheer it on, you know.
How has he been doing for the first four years?

Really, every time he does more action, I really approve more and more of it, you know?  I really do.  He stands for America, you know?  I believe he's a true patriot.  Working hard for us, you know?  I believe that.
